short.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G: Translate your LaTeX math expression to TI-Nspire's format using one keyboard shortcut.

long.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G:
Instructions üìú
1. Select your LaTeX math expression.
2. Press CTRL + SHIFT + Z to translate and copy the expression. *
3. Paste the translated expression with CTRL + V.
* the shortcut can be changed at Chrome's extension settings (chrome://extensions/shortcuts)

Features ‚≠ê
The extension translates:
- basic characters (e.g. parentheses, comparison operators)
- units and constants (optional)
- fractions
- square roots
- higher roots
- absolute values
- exponents
- logarithms (log, ln, lg, lb)
- equation pairs
- systems of equations
- subscripts
- trigonometric functions
- unit vectors (i and j)
- Euler's number (optional)
- integrals
- derivatives
- limits
- sum notations
- product notations
- matrices
- gcd and lcm
- binomial coefficients
- adds multiplication signs between variables
- converts decimal commas to decimal points
- removes LaTeX notations that don't have an equivalent in TI-Nspire

Translating units and constants üìê
- you can choose whether to translate units and constants by clicking the extension icon in the top-right corner
- you can also select which one to prioritize (e.g., the notation "g" can represent both a unit and a constant)


FOR EDUCATIONAL PURPOSES ONLY
